bill_title: require notice to property owners in certain eminent domain cases.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require notice to property owners in certain eminent domain cases. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 21-35-2 be amended to read as follows: 21-35-2. A petition filed pursuant to § 21-35-1 shall name the person, group, or corporation desiring to take or damage private property as plaintiff, and all persons having interest in or liens upon the property affected by the proceeding as defendants, so far as they shall be known at the time of filing the same. It shall contain a description of the property to be taken or damaged. The purpose for which the property is to be taken or damaged shall be clearly set forth in the petition. It shall not be necessary to specify the interests or claims of the several defendants in the land or property affected by the proceeding. The defendant shall be notified not less than six months before the petition is filed of the plaintiff's intention to file the petition and the specific nature of the petition, including a description of the property to be taken or damaged and the purpose for which the property is to be taken or damaged. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
